meanings.definition: To convert text into the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: She was romanizing the ancient script for easier reading.
meanings.sent2: The software automatically romanizes non-Latin characters.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he romanized his friend's name into Latin for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her magic pen romanized the mystical symbols into understandable text.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's job was to romanize the foreign words for the students.

meanings.definition: To make something Roman in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The architect was romanizing the building's design with columns and arches.
meanings.sent2: The museum curator romanized the exhibit to resemble ancient Roman artifacts.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly romanized his daily routine by pretending to be a Roman emperor.
meanings.sent4: Her words romanized the atmosphere, transporting everyone to ancient Rome.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes romanized the canvas, evoking a sense of Roman grandeur.
